summary: Completed comprehensive testing of Product Delivery Context feature - all backend API tests passed (21/21 = 100%), frontend UI tests passed (9/9 = 100%)
passed_tests: GET /api/delivery-context - Creates empty context if none exists
PUT /api/delivery-context - Updates context with valid data
GET /api/delivery-context - Returns previously updated data (persistence verified)
PUT validates delivery_methodology enum: waterfall, agile, scrum, kanban, hybrid
PUT rejects invalid delivery_methodology values with 400 status
PUT validates delivery_platform enum: jira, azure_devops, none, other
PUT rejects invalid delivery_platform values with 400 status
UI: Settings page loads with Delivery Context tab as default
UI: All form fields present and functional (Industry, Methodology, Sprint Length, Sprint Date, Developers, QA, Platform)
UI: Dropdown selects work correctly for Methodology and Platform
UI: Save Context button works and shows success message
UI: Data persists correctly after page reload
critical_code_review_comments: Code quality is good - proper enum validation, error handling, and data persistence
All data-testid attributes are present for UI testing
PUT endpoint does full replacement (not PATCH) - this is documented behavior
seed_data_creation: Created test user (user_8e516f753c38) with session token (test_session_8401ef389c9b4660824a684694e505a5) and active subscription for testing
context_for_next_testing_agent: Product Delivery Context feature is fully functional. Test user credentials: session_token=test_session_8401ef389c9b4660824a684694e505a5, email=test.delivery@example.com. The delivery context is stored per user and automatically created on first GET. Valid enum values: delivery_methodology (waterfall, agile, scrum, kanban, hybrid), delivery_platform (jira, azure_devops, none, other).
